texts.definition: The enjoyment of together with other players handling very chaotic or challenging gameplay situations.
markups: <style="Definition">The enjoyment of together with other players handling very chaotic or challenging gameplay situations.</style>

Many games put players in stressful situations where they need to quickly handle multiple or confusing challenges. When players need to do so together and somehow manage to feel that they are handling the situation to some level of satisfaction, they can have <style="CurrentLink">Mutual FUBAR Enjoyment</style>.

The players of the board game <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Space%20Alert">Space Alert</link></style> need to plan their actions together in advance to handle multiple treats while at the same time making sure that the logistics needed are maintained. Since players can rather easily become overwhelmed or be unsure if they have taking into account everything that needs to be done, the game opens up for opportunities of <style="CurrentLink">Mutual FUBAR Enjoyment</style>.

Players of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Left%204%20Dead%20series">Left 4 Dead series</link></style> have an easier time completing levels if they work together but simultaneously handling hordes and the special enemies that can incapacitate players create very chaotic situations in which <style="CurrentLink">Mutual FUBAR Enjoyment</style> can occur.

Creating <style="CurrentLink">Mutual FUBAR Enjoyment</style> is basically creating <style="Link"><link="fubar-enjoyment">FUBAR Enjoyment</link></style> for a group of people. Thus, the main requirement for <style="CurrentLink">Mutual FUBAR Enjoyment</style> is to design <style="CurrentLink">Mutual FUBAR Enjoyment</style> in a <style="Link"><link="multiplayer-games">Multiplayer Game</link></style> but also make players experience that they are playing together. The latter can be done through enforcing or encouraging <style="Link"><link="parties">Parties</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style>, but pitching players against the game system through <style="Link"><link="pve">PvE</link></style> or by having <style="Link"><link="mutual-goals">Mutual Goals</link></style> can also work. A slightly more risky design solution is to make some players suffer from <style="Link"><link="helplessness">Helplessness</link></style> and giving other players <style="Link"><link="rescue">Rescue</link></style> goals related to this. The experience of all of these ways to create gameplay where players are working towards similar goals can be augmented by allowing or making necessary <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Coordination">Coordination</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Negotiation">Negotiation</link></style>.

Making players feel that they are in each other's proximity, either because they <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Unmediated%20Social%20Interaction">Unmediated Social Interaction</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Virtual%20Co-Presence">Virtual Co-Presence</link></style> can increase the feeling of players having the experience of <style="CurrentLink">Mutual FUBAR Enjoyment</style> together.

Both the likelihood and intensity of <style="CurrentLink">Mutual FUBAR Enjoyment</style> can be increased if players can communication with each other. While <style="Link"><link="communication-channels">Communication Channels</link></style> can be necessary if <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Coordination">Coordination</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Negotiation">Negotiation</link></style> is a part of what encourages <style="CurrentLink">Mutual FUBAR Enjoyment</style>, having <style="Link"><link="communication-channels">Communication Channels</link></style> also lets players talk about the experience they are having as they are having it.

<style="CurrentLink">Mutual FUBAR Enjoyment</style> is a way to provide players with both <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Mutual%20Experiences">Mutual Experiences</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="togetherness">Togetherness</link></style>, and successfully handling the gameplay can create sense of <style="Link"><link="team-accomplishments">Team Accomplishments</link></style>. However, failure might cause <style="Link"><link="guilting">Guilting</link></style> to occur and this can work against the sense of <style="Link"><link="togetherness">Togetherness</link></style>.

Like the case for <style="Link"><link="fubar-enjoyment">FUBAR Enjoyment</link></style>, players having <style="CurrentLink">Mutual FUBAR Enjoyment</style> are preoccupied with immediate problems and therefor may have difficulties considering <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Risk/Reward">Risk/Reward</link></style> situations.

<style="Link"><link="fubar-enjoyment">FUBAR Enjoyment</link></style> together with <style="Link"><link="helplessness">Helplessness</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="mutual-goals">Mutual Goals</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="parties">Parties</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="pve">PvE</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="rescue">Rescue</link></style>, or <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style> in <style="Link"><link="multiplayer-games">Multiplayer Games</link></style>
